page.title: 06Tillingbourne Trout Farm p2
page.content:
Large numbers of trout need plenty of fast-flowing water. The water source is a lake above the farm. The good water supply makes this a suitable site for the farm. The fish tanks are circular, with a self-cleaning action as the water flow circulates round, sweeping debris out through a shielded central hole into an overflow pipe maintaining the level inside. The fish swim against the flow. The farm buy in fry and rear them to table size. They breed a small number of fish compared to their final output. A pound of fish costs Â£1.50.
A team of conservationists have recently set up an old cast-iron water wheel. This uses water from the lake and is hoped in future to drive a grinding machine to recycle fish offal for the animal feed mill next door.
